Jennifer Aniston Oscar-Bound with John Mayer!

Jennifer Aniston Oscar-Bound with John Mayer!

Jennifer Aniston will be heading to the Oscars this year with boyfriend John Mayer according to Popsugar!

The 31-year-old singer said, “I’ll give you the scoop. I’m going to the Oscars!” He continued, “It’s my first Oscars. And it’s my first being an Oscar boyfriend. After that night I have a deal almost signed in blood that says I must go into the studio and finish this record. So after Oscar Sunday, Monday morning I’m invisible!”

We’ll see how invisible he’ll really be!

Just Jared on Facebook
Photos: WENN
Posted to: Jennifer Aniston, John Mayer

View Full Version : Me and my crazy dreams...

02-01-2005, 10:14 AM
Last night I had a really disturbing "X-Files" dream (Scully and all). I hadn't even been watching the show so I have NO idea where this came from...
================================================== ========

So... I show up as an agent for the FBI and there is a field of corpses where a UFO had been sighted. We find a young girl (presumably played by the fabulous Dakota Fanning) in the middle of all these dead bodies. The one next to her was a man whose body was still intact but a giant chunk of his lower right leg had been burned to the bone. She's the only one who lived. We take her back to HQ and are trying to figure out what happened. On the way out, Scully sees one of the bodies moving and they have the body med/evac'd to a military hospital.

The little girl eventually comes out of shock to say that she saw the UFO mothership, saw a flash of brilliant light and then she blacked out to awaken on the ship. Somehow she could see what was happening on the ground and all the people were catching on fire. The next thing she knew, she was back on the ground and saw the agents and the helicopters.

Scully rings and tells us to come down to the hospital because something's happened to the patient they brought in. We arrive to see that his flesh is breaking down and that, even though he has cellular structure and tissue fibre, there is barely anything holding him together. His name is "Robbie" and he is conscious and can speak a little but his lips are sticking together due to the consistency of his body tissue. His bones are basically cartilage. He tells us basically what the girl told us, but from a ground observer's point of view. He is so frustrated with what he is turning into that he struggles and rips his hands and feet off as he tries to break from the safety restraints. All of his bodily fluids start pouring out all over the floor and he dies.

We do some research and there seems to be a wave of sightings. The event where all the people got burned happened after the time between sightings in that area decreased. We notice that something similar is happening in another area so I am sent out there to investigate before the next event takes place.

I am driving down this country road where there is an occasional estate set way back along this one hill that is covered in trees. To my left is pretty much all grain fields. I come to a crossroad and have to stop. Another car is coming from my right. The car slows down to a crawl as it passes. Though I cannot see clearly into the car, I notice that the driver is looking at me. I take the plate and make of the car before it speeds away.

I continue driving down the road to this area where the UFOs seem to be hovering over from time to time and where a lot of the sightings are taking place. The road eventually turns into a driveway to a modest country estate that sits atop a hill.

I get out of the car and start walking up a gravel service drive. I see a gardener and call out to him. He looks up and scowls. I hear him muttering something to me but it is not in English. He turns away and starts heading for a shed. I continue toward the house and see a wooden staircase that leads to a lower part of the property behind the house. I decide to take it. As I am heading down, I round this corner and bump into a young man who looks like "Robbie", the boy we brought into the hospital. He stares intensely at me and pushes past me. I noticed that his skin is severely scarred. I turn around and call out, "Robbie?" He turns around, opens his mouth and out comes this deathly scream like the roar of a million people dying.

...then I woke up.

02-01-2005, 10:33 AM
Thats a pretty cool dream :D Maybe it is one of those "to be continued" type of dreams.I've had those,very weird,like they pick up night after night(TV show in my mind ;))

02-01-2005, 11:14 AM
The fact that you remembered that much detail amazes me more than the content, which was extraordinary to say the least. I usually only remember the basic plot and some random detail (i.e. the color of something). Let us know how it ends! :D

02-01-2005, 11:57 AM
I remember so many of my dreams in that kind of detail, which is probably why I am tired all the time. I really don't understand how they manage to be so tangible as if they were real experiences. I can tell you the exact colour of clothing people were wearing and how things smelled and what the flowers looked like.

02-01-2005, 12:18 PM
You should have some sort of sleep analysis done. Perhaps you're not completely asleep. That could explain why your tired after "resting" and it might help to explain why your dreams are so vivid. Maybe by being awake your getting more detail (because your concious) than the rest of us, who are so unconcious were drooling.

02-01-2005, 12:53 PM
My friend, Heidi, and I were with a group of people, taking a hike on a mild winter day. We followed this trail over a hill, into a deep valley and then back up another hill to a shelter of sorts. The shelter looked like a picnic pavilion but with waist-high stone walls around it. In the centre of the shelter were two large fireplaces that you could look into from either side. We had gotten all of our overnight gear set up and had a stew dinner. The group started cleaning up when someone said they saw a bright object fall from the sky. We looked over to where they thought it went. There was a bright glow over the hill from where we had come earlier in the day.

We watched it for a bit and then saw something start to rise from behind the hill. It was a huge black object with a strange glow and lights all over the surface of it. Suddenly, everyone started to feel what felt like sand being blown onto one's face by a strong wind. Someone looked over at another one of the campers and said that they were bleeding... like little cuts were all over their face. It was happening to everyone, so all of us ducked behind the stone wall. We stayed there until morning and packed up to head back into town.

When we arrived in town, we noticed that the place looked deserted. Someone the people were still injured from the night before so we headed for the hospital. We discovered that everyone who remained in town had holed up there overnight and the only power was coming from the emergency generators. We were in the basement at the time, but there were still patients on the upper floors. We heard screaming, so I ran up the stairs with several other people. The windows were shattering and that "sand feeling" was happening again. We got all of the patients out into the hall and called for others to help bring them to the basement.

There was noise coming from above, so my group went to the roof hatch and waited for whatever to come in while Heidi helped with the injured. We heard movement in the hall below and went back down after jamming the roof hatch shut. Apparently, the aliens had come through the window. We didn't have any weapons, so we decided to use the fire hoses to push them back. After a few moments, the aliens started to fall to the floor and die. It was later discovered that they had no immunity to the microbes that lived in the water.

02-01-2005, 01:07 PM
Maybe your dreams are actually signs from God (or whatever you prefer) that this particular plot would make a killer movie and make you a million bucks.

02-02-2005, 10:01 PM
My friend, Heidi, and I were with a group of people, taking a hike on a mild winter day.
In Switzerland? :D

06-30-2006, 02:40 PM
Decided to drag this thread back up.

Last night I had a dream I was being chased by a white rabbit.Funny afterwords,but I woke up in the middle of the night because of it. Looking at dream meanings,the rabbit symbolizes transformation,white signals new beginnings,and apparently being chased by an animal symbolizes unexpressed anger. All quite interesting,,whether the symbols are actually "true" or not.

Or perhaps I've made too many jokes about bunnies and going insane with my friends. Its just decided to come back to haunt me LOL

Phantom-like Menace
07-01-2006, 11:36 PM
I had a dream with naked characters from Newsradio. It started out with that red-headed chick naked and washing her house, which means it started out bad. It then involved Andy Dick who was wearing a bathrobe that wasn't covering anything, which means it got worse. I woke up just after Maura Tierny pulled up naked in a car, so it at least ended on a high note. I truly wish I were making this up, though.

Whedonesque - a community weblog about Joss Whedon
"Oh no. Is that dragon thing behind me?"
11980 members | you are not logged in | 18 October 2018


May 03 2012

A look at Joss Whedon's rise in popularity. "Joss Whedon doesn't belong to us anymore. He belongs to the world now."

Funny, I just posted some interviews with him on another board I belong to, and said that I was sorry but no, world, you can't have him. We saw him first.

Over the moon for Joss' success, but not sure I'm ready to 'lose' him to the masses.

Not that I have anything to say about it, just feels... lossy.
So Whedony, and yet it made me want to go watch the first episode of Studio 60.

There's a monthly get together of fans of Whedon in my city, that I've been trying to get to since January, but something always causes me to end up missing it. Looks like it's going to happen again this month too... Anyway this article suddenly had me wondering if a small gathering like that is going to start growing big time because of this... Interesting...
A touching article to me. Yet, world fame simply had to come to Joss some day. Everything else would have been - unjust.
Just like there were only like 150K people at Woodstock, yet millions of people claim they were there. In a few years, EVERYONE will be claiming to have been a Joss Whedon fan all along.

[ edited by Penthos on 2012-05-03 17:16 ]
I think he'll always belong to us in some way. He's been part 'mine' since I was 11 and watched Buffy for the first time. So for him not to be just ours is going to take time getting use to but I'm just so happy and proud of him for his success and recognition which is long past due.
I said the other day that our fandom is about to turn into a popular tourist destination and I think that is probably going to be true. A lot of new people will decend on us. Some will stay and join us, while others will go back home, coming back occasionally when a new project hits the screen. We will expand and change. We won't be the same again, but I'm not sure we can anticipate how much we will actually change. Joss's way of looking at things will still be difficult for many people to appreciate. I would not be surprised if many who love the Avengers will look at his other work and simply feel that it just isn't for them.
Indeed a touching article. But I have to wonder, what does the "us" even mean? At what point could one have become a part of this "us"? In 1997, when Buffy came out? Or in 2002, when Firefly came out? Or in 2005, when Serenity came out? I don't think The Avengers marks the end of an era at all. People discovered Joss through Firefly, then other new people discovered him through Serenity, and others still after DH, and after Dollhouse, and now after Cabin... it's an ongoing process.

Tying Joss' work to the time of its release does an injustice to the work itself. I found Joss just three years ago, watching Buffy on a whim. Should I consider myself a part of "us" or not? I wasn't around to see Firefly get cancelled, but don't I feel the monstrous injustice of it every time I watch it?

Of course it's nice being part of a "secret society" but frankly, there will always be more people who don't know Joss' work than people who do. It's just that the community will be a bit bigger and, considering the ever-increasing number of projects to talk about, a lot happier.
This was a really well written article! Gave me goosebumps a few times. All I hope for is that his "new found" fame will give him the leeway to produce many more of his own stories. Getting something new from Joss at least once a year would be awesome.
I'm all for more people falling in love with Joss. Spreading the joy is a good thing.
prettymaryk - I think the "us" refers to anyone that has discovered Joss in a non mainstream way (in other words, any one that discovered him from anything other than The Avengers... so yes, you too). Erg, I had other thoughts but I'm having trouble wrangling them. So I'll leave it at 'and what that could entail.'

Also part of those other thoughts is something along the lines of 'not saying this is going to be bad, just very strange and different and interesting'

[ edited by DreamRose311 on 2012-05-03 18:26 ]
I know. I've been trying to come to terms with it. People get excited about The Avengers, and I just wanna rant and rave about Joss Whedon to them, but then I remember what he says in interviews, that it's not supposed to be about him. It's about the work. Let people respond to the work and come to appreciate him on his own terms. I feel like I've been safeguarding this extraordinary secret for over a decade, and now, finally, the truth is out. Joss Whedon is getting his long overdue public recognition.
You can rant and rave about Joss to them. Why shouldn't you? It's still a Joss Whedon film. Buffy is bigger than Joss too, he's just the one that drives it.
Once someone saw me on whedonesque and knew who joss was cause of buffy. that was the only time a 'norm' has mentioned joss to me.
the only other people I know are the friend who introduced to buffy,and my brother who I introduced to whedon.IRL,I mean. obviously I know a lot of people online.

Now I've seen people talk excitedly about Avengers and it's strange, cause I've been following the comics for a million years and Joss for longer.

I do hope that this means more people will know the amazingness that is Joss. Dr Horrible,Firefly,Dollhouse,Buffy,and beyond. cause they are all awesome and I want them to be known, but I guess it is a bit scary,like will they appreciate him properly?
I'm sorry, but doesn't Joss get a say in this? Unless he starts doing only big mainstream movies, his fanbase is probably going to remain mostly geeky. I mean, more people wil know who he is,enjoy his work, but it doesn't mean they'll rush out to see Much Ado. I agree with those who said people discovered Joss through Firefly, Dollhouse, DHSAB, etc. Those people are, in general, thesame type of people as the orgininal fans. And that's the same here. Anyone who takes the effort to go back and watch all of Joss's previous work becuase they love his new stuff so much can't deny they're as non-mainstream oriented as the rest of us.

And in that case, I welcome new fans, for they'll be no different than the rest of us. Those who really appreciate Joss... really appreciate Joss.

[ edited by wasabi17 on 2012-05-03 21:09 ]
I don't know how to feel about this. I just suppose it's "selfishness" to want to say "well, I had him first!" in an ex-boyfriend kind of way. Kind of like being obsessed with the Arcade Fire since 2002 then hearing their song at the end of the Hunger Games movie.
I've been trying to explain the way I feel about Joss not being "ours" anymore, the only thing I could think of to compare this to is the way I felt being part of the early punk scene when CBGB's was my 2nd home circa 1977 and The Ramones were just another awesome band I saw a million times (I got jumped in my home town because I was wearing a leather jacket and a Ramones shirt, didn't matter that I was a skinny girl)... it became weird when they became so well-known but I had that strange feeling of pride, like "I'm so happy for my boys but do I have to share them with the world???"
But in the long run, the world will be a much better place with a lot more Joss Whedon in it.
Oh hell, I'm just so giddy and happy for Joss and us!!!
Sorry, but he does belong to me, or that certificate of authentication is total BS.
My worry was more about the inevitable tearing down that happens when someone is lauded for pretty much anything. Then I started to think about it. He's got a house that is 20 times nicer than where I live, a gorgeous partner, uber talented family and friends with nice noses, he's obviously smarter and funnier than me, so why the Hell am I worried about him? He'll be fine.
I've been a fan of his long before I knew his name. And I don't mean that in a hipster sort of way. Just that I'm kind of clueless and unaware a lot of the time. But now that Avengers seems to be an OK flick, (I'm guessing based on what little buzz there is online...;) ), I'm assuming that there will be more Joss stuff in the future and maybe now people won't mess with it before we get it. Or mess with it while we are getting it. And then cancelling it before it's done. So, bring on the masses, I say!
What concerns me though is actually the fandom getting too big to feel like, uh, home? (Yes, I'm getting sappy. Shut up.) So, yeah. Whatever.

ETA: and he probably doesn't make typos either.

[ edited by NYPinTA on 2012-05-04 14:47 ]
Happened to catch to glimpse of Joss with the Captain America shield in someone's paper on the train. 2 pages in the DC Metro's Express!

I would argue, Joss has never belonged to his fans, and that change is inherent to the communities that have formed in response to his work. I think it's pretty cool he's made a big movie a lot of people seem to like, that is also pretty well aligned with his own interests. I think if we define ourselves in terms of the obscureness of our interests, we're setting ourselves up for disappointment, anyway. Culture's always changing.
I completely understand the "lossiness" of sharing our beloved Whedon with the masses. But seriously, folks...wouldn't the world be a much better place if more people were Whedon fans? Think of all the marvelous, valuable, tickle-your-heart life lessons Whedon's works have taught you (taught US!) over the years. And now, maybe, fingers crossed, multiply that by millions for whom The Avengers becomes a gateway to exploring all things Whedonesque. Imagine if millions more got to know Buffy or Mal as role models. If millions more started questioning if the status is really quo after all. If more people start behaving, as Angel says, "as though the world were as it should be, to show it what it can be." Don't we want the whole world to have these images tumbling 'round in their heads and h... (truncated)

about this blog

Who is the Food Network Addict? He's the guy serving up the latest news and gossip on your favorite celebrity chefs. From Rachael Ray to Ina Garten, Paula Deen to Giada, he's got you covered. Stop by daily and feed your addiction.

blog advertising is good for you.

Wednesday, January 9

Rachael Rayscapades

According to the New York Post's Starr Report, Rachael Ray will tape an episode of her daytime talkshow "completely on ice." The chilly ep will air on Jan. 31 to coincide with the first day of February sweeps.

Rachael, who will enter the show via Zamboni, will also have her guests don ice skates as they cavort around New York's Bryant Park ice rink.


Ummm... what kind of cooking will Rachael do while on the ice? Perhaps she'll just dig a hole and do some old-fashioned ice fishing? I'm sure there's lots of interesting creatures living in the New York City sewer.

Friday, November 30th Daily Discussion · DAYS: News, Spoilers & Discussion

Behind the Video: Azealia Banks – ‘Liquorice’

Azealia Banks

Earlier this week, Azealia Banks unleashed her second music video for “Liquorice,” a cut off her EP 1991. Now Noisey takes us behind the scenes as Yung Rapunxel transforms into a cowgirl and prepares for a showdown in the desert with a horse, hot dog, and guns.

After launching her career with the viral sensation “212,” Banks ups the ante, calling on director Rankin and Lady Gaga’s stylist Nicola Formichetti, who put together high-end looks mixed with some of her own clothing.

She was able to execute her vision thanks to a bigger budget. “We can’t do another $50 video, so let’s come up with something that’s gonna look like some money,” said Banks.

When it comes to her rapid rise to fame, she admits, “I actually thought it would happen sooner.”

Candid Yams: Beyoncé & Jay-Z Have Dinner In NYC

Kid Fury October 22, 2012 Candid Yams 13 Comments

Lady Honey Lavender Lamb Queen On High was spotted having a sweet dinner in NYC’s Battery Park with her husband King Shawn and Queen Mother Tina yesterday evening.

The family was not seen with baby Blue, but I’m sure the tiny tot was busy having Kelly Rowland sort out her custom-made Mugler diapers and schooling all kinds of life.

Beyoncé will be performing a reported 12-minute set at the Superbowl on February 3rd and she’s currently working on her fifth studio album. So far, I’ve heard she’s been in the studio with Hit-Boy, The-Dream, Missy Elliott and more.

View Full Version : Profound Thanks

AM Chair
10-07-2002, 08:32 AM
As we return to our nomal lives here in Lancaster, on behalf of the staff of Ani-Magic, I want to send out my heartfelt thanks for supporting the Autumn Dream this year. I have no official numbers yet, but I'm quite sure we had lots more people than than the first two.

I know for sure that we had a lot more cosplayers than 2 years prior. It is personally gratifiying to see my "child" stand up and walk this year. Ani-Magic is in the black, and it will be around for years to come thanks in part from your attendance. We beat very tough odds and pulled this off.

This particular edition has put the last nail in the coffin of politics at AM, something none of us wanted or needed. We have refuted all the rumor and propaganda that tried to kill this con over the summer. Anything said unconstructive about AM now is irrelevant. We'll always accept constructive criticism, but attacks just don't matter anymore. We will always try to make a better con for you.

But you who sew the dreams to life are ones who bring the con to life and we are thankful for that. Anyone can go to a con, but you guys and gals are the ones who provide the color and mystique to the cons of California. My hat's off to you. Thank you again for making Ani-Magic 2002 so successful and for ensuring we can do it again next year.

Revell Walker
Chairman, AM 02

 mensagem postada em 18/08/2009 - 09:08:19hs

Universal Studios Florida opens Hollywood Rip Ride Rockit coaster

By Robert Niles
Published: August 15, 2009 at 12:34 PM
After a delay of several months, Universal Studios Florida has opened its long-awaited musical roller coaster Hollywood Rip Ride Rockit to the public. It is a soft open, so it could close at any time, so ride if you see it available!
The ride opened to Universal employees last night, and to the public today. Reports from readers onsite welcomed in the comments.

No word yet on an official open date or media day.


Os trens da Big Thunder Mountain Railroad tem os seguintes nomes: I. M. Brave, U. R. Courageous, I. B. Hearty, U. B. Bold, I. M. Fearless e U. R. Daring.
